Articles.Content:
On June 16, I had surgery to donate one of my kidneys to someone who needed it.

Both surgeries went well, and I just saw the surgeon for a followup.

He remarked how I was one to two weeks ahead of other donors in my recovery. I told him it was simply Jebediah exercising my brain cells.

Love this game, even with all the warts.

Linuxgurugamer

Edited typo (autocorrect on a phone is so bad sometimes)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-26T20:04:21Z" title="06/26/2015 08:04  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 26, 2015</time> by linuxgurugamer**
That's a great thing to hear (both you recovering well and what you're recovering from).

> He remarked how I was one to two weeks ahead of other diners in my recovery.

Wait...what? Did you just joined a cannibal cult and donate your kidneys (both of them? O\_o) to a cannibal chief that needs some to cook so everyone can dine on it?...

...My insane imagination aside, its great that you recovered so quickly. There is this case of video game helping cancer patient forgetting the pain of their treatment: [http://www.polygon.com/features/2014/1/16/5238330/the-healing-power-of-video-games](http://www.polygon.com/features/2014/1/16/5238330/the-healing-power-of-video-games)

Maybe videogames can assist medical treatment somehow. Should have a hospital full of video games for patients to play while they are there.

> Wait...what? Did you just joined a cannibal cult and donate your kidneys (both of them? O\_o) to a cannibal chief that needs some to cook so everyone can dine on it?...

"Video games are bad for you," my butt. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Good to hear that you are recovering so fast.

Vidya for great recovery!

And more seriously, props for helping someone out in such a manner.

> Wait...what? Did you just joined a cannibal cult and donate your kidneys (both of them? O\_o) to a cannibal chief that needs some to cook so everyone can dine on it?...

> 
> Maybe videogames can assist medical treatment somehow. Should have a hospital full of video games for patients to play while they are there.

If he donated BOTH Kidney's, then he probably wouldn't be with us now... (or on a machine for life...)

Donors of all kinds are needed around the world... either while you are alive, or once you leave this realm... I think LinuxGuruGamer should be given the kerbal equivalent of the Congressional Medal of Honor (or the Victoria Cross) for what he has done... we need more brave souls like him and not just brave Kerbals.

Consider this a cyber pat on the back, and a cyber handshake L.G.G. ... I am proud to (cyber) know you. 

![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Yay, more recovery! Cheers to that awesomeness, and let's keep busting at more missions.
Of course KSP makes recovery faster. Just go to the Space Center, click on your craft and select "Recover" ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
but Jeb is the opsite of a doctor!(Get well soon)
I am amazed by human selflessness sometimes. You are an altruistic hero in my book mate. I wish you a speedy recovery and many, many successful launches!
